Description: Body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery heavy chalice; white slip; interior: glazed black with bands in added red and added white; exterior: painted decoration consisting of lion (part of scaly mane and shoulder remaining) to right; part of pendant roundel as filling ornament.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Akademisches Kunstmuseum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Lemos suggests that the creature depicted on the sherd is possibly a siren, however, the features are more consistent with those of a lion.
